body:
The TestExecutionContext is an internal NUnit structure, not intended to be
referenced across domains. Unfortunately, the TestContext references it.
NUnit itself never serializes TextContext, so the problem only arises when
the test attempts to create its own app domain.

Solving this will take some thought. We don't want TestExecutionContext to
be serializable, since that would require making a lot of internal classes
serializable as well. We might make it an MBR object. Alternatively, we
could simply have TestContext cache values from the execution context and
eliminate the reference.

On Mon, Jul 21, 2014 at 4:04 PM, Paweł Adamowicz notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Accessing multiple app domains from unit tests results in
> SerializationException in version 2.9.6, this is a regression from version
> 2.6.3:
> 
> Repro steps inside unit test:
> - create a new app domain AppDomain.CreateDomain(...)
> - call CreateInstanceFromAndUnwrap(...)
> 
> Exception:
> System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException: Type
> 'NUnit.Framework.Internal.TestExecutionContext' in assembly
> 'nunit.framework, Version=2.9.6.0, Culture=neutral,
> PublicKeyToken=96d09a1eb7f44a77' is not marked as serializable.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/nunit/nunit-framework/issues/156.

issue.title: Fix for issue #156
issue.body: Allowing creation of app domains from within unit tests

issue.title: TestExecutionContext in nunit.framework is not marked as serializable.

milestone.title: Closed Without Action
milestone.description: This milestone contains closed issues where no action was taken. This includes questions, issues that could not be reproduced, rejected ideas, invalid issues, etc.

issue.body: I get the following error when running tests: System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException: Type 'NUnit.Framework.Internal.TestExecutionContext' in Assembly 'nunit.framework, Version=2.9.6.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=96d09a1eb7f44a77' is not marked as serializable.

issue.title: Make TestExecutionContext MBR. Fixes #156
issue.body: This request replaces PR 159, which wasn't completed. It fixes issue #156 by making TestExecutionContext an MBR class. A test was added to illustrate the bug and passes with this fix.
